<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="CautionaryNoteRegardingForwardloo_083647"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CAUTIONARY NOTE REGARDING FORWARD-LOOKING
STATEMENTS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Statements in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K under the caption &#147;Business&#148;
and &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operations&#148; and elsewhere in this report are forward-looking and are based upon
information currently available to the Company.&#160;
The Company, through its officers, directors or employees, may also from
time to time make oral forward-looking statements.&#160; In connection with the &#147;safe harbor&#148;
provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, the Company
is hereby identifying important factors that could cause actual results to
differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statement made by
or on behalf of the Company.&#160; Any such
statement is qualified by reference to these cautionary statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Undue reliance should not be placed on the Company&#146;s forward-looking
statements because the matters they describe are subject to known and unknown
risks, uncertainties and other unpredictable factors, many of which are beyond
the Company&#146;s control.&#160; The Company&#146;s
forward-looking statements are based on the information currently available and
speak only as of the date on which this report was filed with the United States
Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;).&#160;
Over time, actual results, performance or achievements will likely
differ from the anticipated results, performance or achievements that are
expressed or implied by the Company&#146;s forward-looking statements, and such
differences might be significant and materially adverse to the Company&#146;s shareholders.&#160; Many important factors that could cause such
a difference are described in this Annual Report under the caption &#147;Certain Risk
Factors Relating to the Company and the Airline Industry&#148; within Item 1 in this
Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All subsequent written or oral forward-looking statements attributable
to the Company or persons acting on the Company&#146;s behalf are expressly
qualified by the factors described above.&#160;
The Company assumes no obligation, and disclaims any obligation, to
update information contained in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K, including
forward looking statements, as a result of facts, events or circumstances after
the date of this report, except as required by law in the normal course of its
public disclosure practices.</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Parti_053312"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;I</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item1_Business_053313"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 1.
BUSINESS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">MAIR Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Holdings&#148;) is the holding company for Mesaba
Aviation,&nbsp;Inc., a regional air carrier based in Minneapolis, Minnesota (&#147;Mesaba&#148;)
and Big Sky Transportation Co., a regional air carrier based in Billings,
Montana (&#147;Big Sky&#148;).&#160; Mesaba and Big Sky
are each wholly owned subsidiaries of Holdings. &#160;Holdings, Mesaba and Big Sky are referred to
herein collectively as the &#147;Company.&#148;&#160;
Mesaba and Big Sky are the Company&#146;s reportable segments that are
managed independently. &#160;Additional detail
on segment reporting is included in Note 11 of the Notes to Consolidated
Financial Statements contained in this
Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba operates as a regional air carrier providing scheduled passenger
service as &#147;Mesaba Airlines/Northwest Airlink&#148; and &#147;Mesaba Airlines/Northwest
Jet Airlink&#148; under two separate agreements with Northwest Airlines,&nbsp;Inc.,
a wholly owned indirect subsidiary of Northwest Airlines Corporation (&#147;Northwest&#148;),
to 109 cities in the United States and Canada from Northwest&#146;s hub airports in Minneapolis/St.
Paul, Detroit and Memphis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Airline Services Agreement (the &#147;Airlink Agreement&#148;), Mesaba
operates Saab 340 jet-prop aircraft (&#147;Saab&#148;) for Northwest.&#160; This agreement provides for exclusive rights
to designated service areas and extends through June&nbsp;30, 2007.&#160; Under the Airlink Agreement, Mesaba
recognizes revenue for each completed &#147;available seat mile&#148; (the number of
seats in an aircraft multiplied by the number of miles those seats are flown).&#160; Additionally, under the Airlink Agreement,
Mesaba purchases fuel, ground handling and other services from Northwest.&#160; Either Northwest or Mesaba may terminate the
Airlink Agreement on 365&nbsp;days notice.&#160;
The Airlink Agreement may be terminated immediately by Mesaba or Northwest
in the event that the other party is the subject of a bankruptcy or similar proceeding
or is divested of a substantial part of its assets.&#160; Additionally, the non-defaulting party may
terminate the agreement in the event of a breach of a non-monetary provision that
remains uncured for a period of more than 30&nbsp;days after receipt of written
notification of such default, or the breach of a monetary provision that remains
uncured for a period of more than ten days after receipt of written
notification of such default.&#160; Northwest
may also terminate the Airlink Agreement in the event of certain lease and
other performance defaults; change in control events; revocation or failure to
obtain Department of Transportation (&#147;DOT&#148;) certification; failure to elect a
chief executive officer of the Company and Mesaba reasonably acceptable to
Northwest; or if more than 50% of the aircraft subject to the agreement are not
operated for more than seven consecutive days or 25% of such aircraft are not
operated for more than 21 consecutive days, other than as a result of the Federal
Aviation Administration (&#147;FAA&#148;) grounding a specific aircraft type for all
carriers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Regional Jet Services Agreement (the &#147;Jet Agreement&#148;), Mesaba
operates Avro RJ85 regional jets (&#147;RJ85&#148;) for Northwest.&#160; The Jet Agreement extends through April&nbsp;25,
2007.&#160; Under the Jet Agreement, Mesaba
recognizes revenue for each &#147;block hour&#148; flown (the elapsed time between
aircraft departing and arriving at a gate).&#160;
Northwest provides fuel and airport and passenger related services at
Northwest&#146;s expense.&#160; Either Mesaba or
Northwest may immediately terminate the Jet Agreement in the event that the
other party is the subject of a bankruptcy or similar proceeding or is divested
of a substantial part of its assets.&#160; Additionally,
the non-defaulting party may terminate the agreement in the event of a breach
of a non-monetary provision that remains uncured for a period of more than
30&nbsp;days</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">after receipt of written notification of such default, or the breach of
a monetary provision that remains uncured for a period of more than ten&nbsp;days
after receipt of written notification of such default.&#160; Northwest may also terminate the Jet
Agreement in the event of certain lease and other performance defaults; change
in control events; revocation or failure to obtain DOT certification; failure
to elect a chief executive officer of the Company and Mesaba reasonably
acceptable to Northwest; if more than 25% of the aircraft subject to the
agreement are not operated for more than seven consecutive days, other than as
a result of the FAA grounding all RJ85 aircraft for all carriers; or if there
is a strike, cessation or interruption of work involving Mesaba pilots, flight
attendants or mechanics providing jet service.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the agreements, all scheduled flights that Mesaba operates are
designated as Northwest flights using Northwest&#146;s designator code in all
computer reservation systems, including the Official Airline Guide, with an
asterisk and a footnote indicating that Mesaba is the carrier providing the
service.&#160; In addition, flight schedules
of Mesaba and Northwest are closely coordinated to facilitate interline
connections, and Mesaba&#146;s passenger gate facilities at the Minneapolis/St. Paul
International Airport, Detroit Metropolitan Airport and Memphis International
Airport are integrated with Northwest&#146;s facilities in the main terminal
buildings, rather than at the more remote commuter air terminals.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s RJ85 aircraft are painted in the
colors of Northwest Airlines and the Saab aircraft are painted in a distinctive
&#147;Northwest Airlink&#148; configuration, with a Northwest logo in addition to Mesaba&#146;s
name.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba, through the agreements, receives ticketing and certain check-in,
baggage, freight and aircraft handling services from Northwest at certain
airports.&#160; In addition, Mesaba receives
its computerized reservations services from Northwest.&#160; Northwest also performs all marketing,
scheduling, yield management and pricing services for Mesaba&#146;s flights.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to a non-binding letter of intent, Mesaba and Northwest are
currently negotiating a new omnibus airline services agreement intended to
replace the Airlink Agreement and Jet Agreement.&#160; See the &#147;Recent Developments&#148; section&nbsp;below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky operates as a regional carrier based in Billings, Montana,
providing scheduled passenger, airfreight, express package and charter
services.&#160; Big Sky provides scheduled air
service to 18 communities in Montana, Colorado, Idaho, North Dakota, Oregon, Washington
and Wyoming via its Billings hub.&#160; Big
Sky operates 65 scheduled flights per weekday with a reduced weekend schedule&nbsp;that
provides interline and online connecting services, as well as local market
services.&#160; Big Sky also has code-sharing
agreements with Alaska/Horizon Airlines, America West Airlines and Northwest,
where its services are marketed jointly with those air carriers for connecting
flights.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky also provides service between its Billings hub and seven communities
primarily in Central/Eastern Montana and between Moses Lake, Washington,
Portland, Oregon and Boise, Idaho and between Sheridan, Wyoming and Denver,
Colorado under contracts with the DOT&#146;s Essential Air Service (&#147;EAS&#148;)
program.&#160; The EAS program subsidizes air
carriers to provide air service to designated rural communities throughout the
country that could not otherwise economically justify that service based on
their passenger traffic.&#160; The DOT pays
EAS subsidies for each departure in a covered market.&#160; Big Sky bids on the EAS contracts every two
years.&#160; In addition, Big Sky continually
reviews EAS flying opportunities and makes bids with the DOT for flying where
it is operationally and financially feasible.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Competition</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is highly competitive as a result of the Airline
Deregulation Act of 1978 (the &#147;Deregulation Act&#148;), which generally increased
competition by eliminating restrictions on fares and route selection.&#160; The Deregulation Act also contributed to the
withdrawal of national and major carriers from</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">short-haul markets by allowing them to more easily obtain additional
long-haul routes, which can be more efficiently and profitably served by larger
jet aircraft.&#160; Elimination of barriers to
entry into new markets, however, also created greater potential for competing
service by other carriers operating small, fuel-efficient aircraft on
short-haul routes serving small and medium-sized cities.&#160; Mesaba and Big Sky compete with other regional
airlines on most routes they serve.&#160;
Mesaba and Big Sky also face competition from regional carriers offering
service to alternative hubs for connecting flights.&#160; Other carriers, including major carriers, can
at any time institute competing service on routes served by Mesaba or Big Sky.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Airlink Agreement and Jet Agreement do not prohibit Northwest from
contracting with other regional airlines to provide the same services that
Mesaba currently provides.&#160; Northwest
currently has an airline services agreement with Pinnacle Airlines Corp. (&#147;Pinnacle&#148;),
and Pinnacle serves many of the same cities as Mesaba.&#160; Northwest could choose to expand its
agreement with Pinnacle in competition with Mesaba.&#160; Northwest could also choose to establish
relationships with other regional airlines.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competitive factors in the airline industry generally include fares,
frequency and dependability of service, convenience of flight schedules, type
of aircraft flown, airports served, relationships with travel agents, and
efficiency and reliability of reservations systems and ticketing services.&#160; The compatibility of flight schedules with
those of other airlines and the ability to offer through fares and convenient
inter-airline flight connections are also important competitive factors.&#160; Holdings believes its subsidiaries are
competitive with respect to each of such factors because of their relationship
with Northwest, established reputation, cost structure and an aircraft fleet
that is properly suited for the small and medium-sized cities served.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fuel</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company believes that the following arrangements assure an adequate
supply of fuel for current and future operations for both Mesaba and Big Sky,
provided that Northwest does not experience a supply shortage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba has arrangements with Northwest for its fuel requirements.&#160; Certain provisions of the Airlink Agreement
protect Mesaba from fluctuations in aviation fuel prices while the Jet
Agreement requires Northwest to provide RJ85 fuel, at Northwest&#146;s expense, to
Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky purchases a majority of its fuel from Northwest.&#160; Big Sky purchases the balance of its fuel
under arrangements with several fuel suppliers.&#160;
None of these arrangements provides protection from fluctuations in fuel
prices.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fares</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba derives its passenger revenues by selling its capacity to
Northwest at predetermined rates.&#160; Mesaba
is primarily paid by Northwest per available seat mile under the Airlink
Agreement and per completed block hour under the Jet Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky generates its passenger revenues from passenger ticket sales
through participation in Airline Reporting Corp., a clearinghouse for travel
agencies, its own reservations center in Billings, a ticket by mail program and
on-line E-ticketing.&#160; Big Sky has ticketing
and baggage agreements with all major</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">airlines that serve its region, which allow its services to be sold by
those airlines.&#160; Big Sky establishes its
passenger fares on a market-by-market basis utilizing a combination of factors,
including the cost of providing the service based upon projected passenger
levels, the competitive price of alternative means of transportation (including
both air and surface) and the distance between markets.&#160; Big Sky also employs the use of discounts off
the base fares for advance ticket purchases and other special needs passengers
that are common throughout the airline industry.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Regulations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to Federal aviation laws, the DOT and the FAA have certain
regulatory authority over the operations of all air carriers.&#160; The jurisdiction of the FAA extends primarily
to the safety and operational provisions of the Federal Aviation Act, while the
responsibility of the DOT involves principally the regulation of certain economic
aspects of airline operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">FAA Regulation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba and Big Sky each hold an Air Carrier Certificate issued by the
FAA under Part&nbsp;119 of the Federal Aviation Regulations, permitting Mesaba
and Big Sky to conduct flight operations in compliance with Part&nbsp;121 of
the Federal Aviation Regulations, which are the same regulatory requirements applicable
to major airlines.&#160; The FAA regulations
to which Mesaba and Big Sky are subject are extensive and include, among other
items, regulation of aircraft maintenance and operations, equipment, ground
facilities, dispatch, communications, training, weather observation, flight
personnel and other matters affecting air safety.&#160; To ensure compliance with its regulations,
the FAA requires airlines to obtain operating, airworthiness and other
certificates that are subject to suspension or revocation for cause.&#160; Mesaba and Big Sky hold all certificates
necessary for their operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">DOT Regulation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba and Big Sky each hold a Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity
issued by the DOT under federal aviation laws.&#160;
As certificated carriers, Mesaba and Big Sky are required to file
quarterly reports with the DOT, including a report of aircraft operating
expenses and related statistics.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Transportation Security Administration
Regulation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In response to the terrorist attacks of September&nbsp;11, 2001,
Congress enacted the Aviation and Transportation Security Act of 2001 (the &#147;ATSA&#148;).&#160; The ATSA created the Transportation Security Administration (the &#147;TSA&#148;)
to oversee aviation and airport security.&#160;
Among other security measures, the ATSA enhanced background checks,
provided federal air marshals aboard flights, improved flight deck security,
enhanced airline crew security training, improved training of security screening
personnel and enhanced airport perimeter access.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Air Transportation Safety and System
Stabilization Act</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2001, Congress enacted the Air Transportation Safety
and System Stabilization Act.&#160; This
legislation provided cash grants to U.S. airlines to compensate for &#147;direct and
incremental losses&#148; incurred from September&nbsp;11, 2001, through December&nbsp;31,
2001.&#160; Mesaba recognized a pre-tax grant
of approximately $0.3&nbsp;million as &#147;other nonoperating income&#148; in the
accompanying consolidated statements of operations in fiscal 2003, in
accordance with DOT and applicable authoritative accounting guidance.&#160; In addition, Big Sky recognized and received
$0.2&nbsp;million during the period from December&nbsp;1, 2002 (date of
acquisition) to March&nbsp;31, 2003 under the same program.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Emergency Wartime Supplemental Appropriations
Act</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April&nbsp;2003, Congress enacted the Emergency Wartime Supplemental Appropriations Act (the &#147;Wartime Act&#148;),
which included, among other items, a $2.3 billion government grant to U.S.
airlines for security fees previously remitted to the TSA and $100 million for
reimbursement of aircraft cockpit door</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">reinforcement costs.&#160; </font>In connection with reimbursements
under the Wartime Act, for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2004, Mesaba
recognized $2.3 million as &#147;other nonoperating income&#148; and Big Sky recognized
$0.3 million as &#147;other nonoperating income&#148; and $0.2 million as a reduction of &#147;administrative
and other expense&#148; in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.&#160; Retention of these funds requires compliance
with the provisions of the Wartime Act.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Railway Labor Act</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s relations with its labor unions are governed by the
Railway Labor Act (the &#147;RLA&#148;).&#160;
Comprehensive provisions are set forth in the RLA establishing the right
of airline employees to organize and bargain collectively and impose a duty
upon air carriers and their employees to exert every reasonable effort to make
and maintain collective bargaining agreements.&#160;
The RLA contains detailed procedures, which must be exhausted before a
lawful work stoppage&nbsp;may occur, including a formal declaration of an
impasse by the National Mediation Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other Regulations</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Noise Control Act of 1972 and the Aviation Safety and Noise
Abatement Act of 1979, the FAA has authority to monitor and regulate aircraft
engine noise.&#160; Management of Mesaba and
Big Sky believe that their aircraft comply with or are exempt from such
regulations and that Mesaba and Big Sky comply with standards for aircraft exhaust
emissions and fuel storage facilities issued by the Environmental Protection
Agency.&#160; As a foreign carrier operating
in Canada, Mesaba is subject to regulation by the Transport Canada and has been
issued a Foreign Air Carrier Operating Certificate and Canadian Transportation
Agency economic licenses.&#160; Because
Northwest maintains certain contracts with the Department of Defense, Mesaba is
subject to that department&#146;s periodic inspections.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Insurance</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company carries the types of insurance customary in the airline
industry, including coverage for public liability, passenger liability,
property damage, aircraft loss or damage, baggage and cargo liability, and
workers&#146; compensation.&#160; The Company
believes that its insurance coverage is adequate as to the amounts and risks
covered.&#160; However, there can be no
assurance that the insurance carried would be sufficient to protect Mesaba and
Big Sky adequately in the event of a catastrophic accident or event.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Maintenance</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The maintenance performed on the Company&#146;s aircraft can be divided into
two general categories: routine line maintenance and major overhauls.&#160; Mesaba and Big Sky employ their own aircraft,
avionics and engine maintenance staffs that perform substantially all routine
line maintenance to the aircraft and engines.&#160;
As of October&nbsp;2003, Mesaba contracted out most of its major
overhauls on airframes, engines and other rotable parts on the Saab and RJ85
aircraft at FAA authorized facilities.&#160; Major
overhauls on Big Sky&#146;s fleets, including airframes, engines and other rotable
parts, are performed internally or at FAA authorized facilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Airport and Terminal Services</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s ticket counter and baggage-handling space is leased from local
airport authorities or other airlines at all of the airports served.&#160; In 45 of the cities it serves, Mesaba
receives support services under agreements with Northwest.&#160; In accordance with the Airlink Agreement,
Mesaba pays local airport authorities for the use of landing fields at rates
that are based on the number of flights per day, fixed fees, or on the number
of aircraft landings and aircraft weight.&#160;
Northwest pays for Mesaba&#146;s landing fees under the Jet Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba receives other revenue from Northwest, Pinnacle and other
airlines for ground handling services performed at the Minneapolis/St. Paul,
Detroit and other spoke airports.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky leases airport counter, baggage and ramp space for ground
services and customer services at all of the cities it currently serves.&#160; Big Sky contracts for ground handling
services from other airlines as needed.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employees</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company and its subsidiaries employed
approximately 3,950 employees with approximately 45.6% of those employees represented
by labor unions.&#160; Mesaba had
approximately 3,750 (913 part-time) employees and Big Sky had approximately 200
(58 part-time) employees.&#160; Neither Mesaba
nor Big Sky had any official work stoppages&nbsp;during fiscal 2005.&#160; Management, in general, believes that its
relations with the Company&#146;s employees are good.&#160; The Company&#146;s labor agreements are as
follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba negotiated a new agreement with ALPA under Section&nbsp;6 of the
RLA, which became effective January&nbsp;31, 2004.&#160; The mechanics, which constitute 6.5% of Mesaba&#146;s
workforce, are currently working under an agreement that became amendable in August&nbsp;2003.&#160; Mesaba is currently negotiating with the AMFA
under Section&nbsp;6 of the RLA for a new agreement.&#160; Mesaba is also negotiating with the dispatchers,
which constitute 0.6% of Mesaba&#146;s workforce.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  <td width="30%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:30.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mechanics </font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">International Association of Machinists and
  Aerospace Workers</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">August&nbsp;2010</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="30%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:30.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dispatchers</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">United
  Transportation Union</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">December&nbsp;2009</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="30%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:30.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Customer service agents</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">76</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="30%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:30.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management / Administrative / Clerical</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="30%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:30.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">200</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.86%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
