  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2004, Big Sky negotiated a new agreement with the
International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, which was
ratified in January&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cyclicality and Seasonality</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry generally is subject to cyclical moves in the
economy.&#160; Because both personal
discretionary travel and business travel may be expected to decline during
periods of economic weakness, the airline industry tends to experience poorer
financial results during such periods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s cyclicality is tied to the business and operating decisions of
Northwest.&#160; Operations of the major
airlines continue to be impacted by the rapid growth of low cost airlines, the
increasing number of businesses utilizing teleconferencing or web-based
meetings and the advent of internet travel web sites, which enable consumers to
find travel alternatives.&#160; Mesaba has
historically shown greater revenues and earnings in the first and second fiscal
quarters.&#160; Northwest has historically
seen increased leisure travel during these periods on domestic and
international routes, which contributes to an increased number of flights for
Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Seasonal factors, primarily weather conditions and passenger demand,
historically have affected Big Sky&#146;s monthly passenger boardings.&#160; Big Sky has historically shown a higher level
of passenger boardings in the July&nbsp;through December&nbsp;period as
compared with the January&nbsp;through June&nbsp;period for many of the cities
served.&#160; As a result of such factors, Big
Sky&#146;s revenues and earnings historically have been greater during the July&nbsp;through
December&nbsp;period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent Developments</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Northwest Letter of Intent</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;20, 2005, Holdings and Mesaba executed a non-binding
letter of intent with Northwest to allow Mesaba to operate 15 Bombardier CRJ-200
regional jets (&#147;CRJ&#148;) under the Northwest Airlink banner, with exclusive rights
to the next 20 CRJ-200 or CRJ-440 aircraft Northwest Airlines may order.&#160; Mesaba expects to lease the aircraft from
Northwest and expects the first aircraft to enter service before the end of
2005.&#160; Mesaba expects to enter into a new
10-year omnibus airline services agreement with Northwest covering the
operation of the CRJs, Saabs and RJ85s that will replace the existing Airlink
Agreement and the Jet Agreement, which are set to expire in 2007.&#160; As part of the letter of intent, Mesaba
agreed to incur the costs necessary to bring the new CRJ fleet into service.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holdings and Mesaba are currently negotiating the definitive new
omnibus airline services agreement with Northwest, which is subject to final
approval by all parties.&#160; Upon execution
of the definitive agreement, Holdings expects to amend the currently
outstanding warrants held by Northwest to reduce the number of shares of the
Company&#146;s common stock issuable upon exercise from 4,151,922 shares exercisable
at prices from $7.25 to $21.25 per share to an aggregate of 4,112,500 shares exercisable
at a price of $8.74 per share.&#160; The
warrants are expected to expire ten years from the date of the definitive
airline services agreement.&#160; Sixty
percent of the shares are expected to become exercisable upon the delivery of
the 15<sup>th</sup> CRJ aircraft to Mesaba, and an additional 4% of the shares are
expected to become exercisable with each subsequent delivery of the next ten
CRJ aircraft.&#160; Pursuant to the letter of intent,
Holdings also agreed to enter into a registration rights agreement to register
the shares of stock currently held by Northwest and the shares of stock that
will be issuable to Northwest upon exercise of the warrants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Litigation Settlement</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;6, 2005, the Company executed a final settlement agreement
with an investment advisor who had, on the Company&#146;s behalf, purchased debt
securities issued by WorldCom in the principal amount of $3.2 million.&#160; In March&nbsp;2003, the debt securities were
sold for approximately $0.8 million.&#160; On May&nbsp;9,
2005, the Company received a settlement in the amount of $1.8 million in
cash.&#160; The Company will recognize the
recovery resulting from the settlement in the first quarter of fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Certain Risk Factors Relating to the Company
and the Airline Industry</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s operations and financial results are subject to various
risks and uncertainties, some of which are described below.&#160; The Company could also be adversely affected
by additional risks and uncertainties not presently known or believed to be
material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks Related to the Mesaba&#146;s Airlink Agreement and Jet Agreement</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba is dependent on its relationship with Northwest as its major
customer, and the loss of this relationship would substantially harm the
Company&#146;s financial results.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2005, Northwest accounted for 92.7% of the Company&#146;s
operating revenues.&#160; Additionally, Mesaba
consistently carries a receivable due from Northwest between $20 million to $30
million.&#160; Northwest has incurred
significant losses in the last several years, including a net loss of $862
million in 2004 and a net loss of $450 million in the first quarter of 2005.&#160; If Northwest continues to incur operating losses,
it may be unable to fulfill its financial obligations and may be forced to
initiate bankruptcy proceedings.&#160; Because
Holdings has no commitment to fund Mesaba&#146;s operations, if Northwest defaults
or otherwise fails to make a payment to Mesaba prior to filing for bankruptcy,
Mesaba would hold an unsecured prepetition bankruptcy claim that it may be
unable to collect.&#160; In such
circumstances, if Mesaba is unable to secure alternate financing, it could be
forced to file for bankruptcy protection.&#160;
The Company&#146;s business could also be adversely affected by events at
Northwest outside of bankruptcy, such as an inability by Northwest to reduce
labor expenses and other costs, continued and unsustainable operating losses at
Northwest, changes in Northwest&#146;s business plan or model, employee strike or
job actions, significant curtailment of service (and thus curtailment of the
utilization of the Company&#146;s aircraft), continued volatility of fuel costs and
terrorist events.&#160; Loss of the Company&#146;s
business relationship with Northwest or Northwest&#146;s failure to make timely
payment of amounts owed to the Company would have a material adverse effect on
the Company&#146;s operations, financial position and cash flows.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If Mesaba&#146;s Airlink Agreement or Jet Agreement with Northwest is
terminated, the Company could lose its only significant source of revenue and
earnings, Mesaba&#146;s regional fleet, access to airport facilities and the
services Northwest provides.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any termination of the Airlink Agreement or Jet Agreement by Northwest,
through bankruptcy or otherwise, would allow Northwest the right to terminate Mesaba&#146;s
aircraft leases and subleases covered by the agreements.&#160; Northwest would also be allowed to take
immediate possession of the aircraft.&#160; As
a result, the Company would have no significant sources of revenue or
earnings.&#160; Additionally, the Company
risks losing the use of Northwest&#146;s systems, airport facilities and other
services that support the Company&#146;s operations.&#160;
The Company may not be able to find replacement services, or it may not
be able to find such services on terms or conditions as favorable as those
received from Northwest.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Northwest has not guaranteed that it will grow Mesaba&#146;s regional fleet
and Northwest could opt to utilize other regional airlines.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Neither the Airlink Agreement nor Jet Agreement provide that Mesaba&#146;s fleet
will grow beyond its existing size.&#160;
Additionally, the agreements do not prohibit Northwest from contracting
with other regional airlines to provide the same services that Mesaba currently
provides.&#160; Finally, the Company&#146;s letter
of intent with Northwest is non-binding, so there is no guarantee that
Northwest will place the new CRJ aircraft with Mesaba. &#160;Northwest currently has an airline services
agreement with Pinnacle, and Pinnacle serves many of the same cities as
Mesaba.&#160; Northwest could choose to expand
its agreement with Pinnacle in competition with Mesaba.&#160; Northwest could also choose to establish
relationships with other regional airlines.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Airlink Agreement and Jet Agreement place constraints on Mesaba&#146;s
ability to provide airline services to airlines other than Northwest.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Both the Airlink Agreement and Jet Agreement provide that Mesaba cannot
use any of its officers, employees, facilities, equipment or aircraft that it
uses to provide airline services to Northwest in any new operations with
another airline without the prior written consent of Northwest.&#160; Any services provided to another airline
would have to be provided by a subsidiary independent of Mesaba, and doing so
could result in significant costs to the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">In connection with the Company&#146;s letter of intent with Northwest,
Mesaba has incurred, and will continue to incur, significant expenses in
connection with bringing the CRJ aircraft into its fleet, and it may not be
reimbursed for these expenses if a definitive agreement is not signed.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s non-binding letter of intent with Northwest provides that
Mesaba will place the first CRJ aircraft in service by October&nbsp;15,
2005.&#160; Although the parties have not yet
signed a definitive agreement, Mesaba has incurred and will continue to incur substantial
expenses related to adding the CRJ aircraft to its fleet.&#160; If an agreement with Northwest is not
finalized, there is no assurance that Mesaba will recognize revenue to offset these
start-up expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks Related to the Company&#146;s Business and Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company&#146;s success is dependent on its ability to obtain all
necessary aircraft, engines, parts and related maintenance and support from
various aircraft manufacturers and vendors.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is dependent on various aircraft manufacturers and other
vendors to provide sufficient parts and related maintenance and support
services on a timely basis.&#160; Additionally,
the Company relies on various engine manufacturers for parts, repair and
overhaul services and other types of support services.&#160; The failure of aircraft or engine
manufacturers and other vendors to provide parts or related services on a</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">timely, cost-effective basis could materially and adversely affect the
Company&#146;s business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Because the Company is unable to pass along increased operating costs,
the Company&#146;s earnings will be negatively affected as its fleets continue to
age.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As the Company&#146;s fleet of aircraft age, the cost of maintaining the
aircraft will likely increase.&#160; Because
many aircraft components are required to be replaced after specified numbers of
flight hours or take-off and landing cycles, and because new aviation
technology may be required to be retrofitted, the cost to maintain aging
aircraft will generally exceed the cost to maintain newer aircraft.&#160; Any material increase in such costs will have
a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s business, financial condition and
results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If Mesaba loses certain of its ground handling business, the Company&#146;s
results of operations could be materially affected.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba performs various ground handling services for Northwest and
Pinnacle at Minneapolis, Detroit and certain spoke stations.&#160; Ground handling business is highly
competitive, and airlines are constantly reviewing their cost structures to
locate the most cost-effective ground handling providers.&#160; If Northwest or Pinnacle terminate Mesaba&#146;s
ground handling services, the Company&#146;s financial results would be materially
affected, both through a loss of revenue and increased transition expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company could incur significant costs if it experiences difficulty
finding, training and retaining employees.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s business is labor-intensive, and the Company requires
large numbers of pilots, flight attendants, maintenance technicians and other
personnel.&#160; The airline industry has from
time to time experienced a shortage of qualified personnel, specifically pilots
and maintenance technicians.&#160; In
addition, as is common with most of the Company&#146;s competitors, the Company has
faced considerable turnover of its employees.&#160;
For example, the Company&#146;s pilots, flight attendants and maintenance
technicians occasionally leave to work for larger airlines, which generally
offer higher salaries and more extensive benefit programs than regional
airlines are financially able to offer.&#160;
In the event of a significant increase in the turnover of employees, the
Company would incur significantly higher training costs than would otherwise be
necessary.&#160; The Company cannot provide
assurance that it will be able to recruit, train and retain the qualified
employees it requires to carry out its business plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company could be adversely affected by the highly competitive
nature of the airline industry.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is highly competitive, and Northwest competes not
only with other regional carriers, but also with low-cost airlines and major
airlines on many of its routes, including the routes that Mesaba flies.&#160; Some of these competitors are significantly
larger and possess greater resources than Northwest.&#160; Moreover, any new entry in the markets Mesaba
serves could lessen the economic benefits Northwest derives from servicing
these markets.&#160; Finally, Big Sky also
competes with low-cost and regional carriers on its routes, and it faces the
same competitive challenges described above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company&#146;s ability to diversify within the airline industry may be
limited by the terms of various collective bargaining agreements and by other
airlines&#146; business agreements.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s labor collective bargaining agreement with its own pilots
limits the types of aircraft Big Sky may fly. &#160;Mesaba&#146;s and Big Sky&#146;s ability to provide
regional service to other major air carriers may also be limited by those</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">carriers&#146; existing relationships with other regional operators.&#160; Additionally, many of the labor collective
bargaining agreements of major airlines, including Northwest, contain scope
clause restrictions that limit the airlines&#146; ability to add new regional
jets.&#160; These factors could prevent the
Company from pursuing future diversification opportunities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company&#146;s compliance with various regulations governing the airline
industry can be costly, and the Company could be harmed if it fails to comply
with such regulations.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Airlines are subject to extensive regulatory and legal requirements
that involve significant compliance costs that result in increased costs for
passengers and the Company.&#160; The FAA, DOT
and TSA periodically propose additional laws, regulations, taxes and airport
rates and charges.&#160; Such measures could
have the effect of raising ticket prices, reducing revenue, increasing costs or
reducing demand for air travel.&#160; The
Company expects to continue incurring expenses to comply with existing and
future regulations.&#160; Moreover, if the
Company fails to comply with applicable regulations, it may be subject to
sanctions, including the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>warning
letters;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>fines;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>injunctions;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>orders
relating to grounding of aircraft, inspection of aircraft, installation of new
safety-related items and removal and replacement of certain aircraft parts; or</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>criminal
prosecutions.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Future terrorist attacks, other world events, general economic
conditions and other factors beyond the Company&#146;s control could substantially
harm the Company.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The terrorist attacks of September&nbsp;11, 2001 and the prolonged unrest
in the Middle East materially affected and continue to affect the airline
industry.&#160; Concerns about further
terrorist attacks have had a negative impact on air travel demand.&#160; In addition, security procedures introduced
at airports since the attacks have increased the inconvenience of air travel,
both in reality and in customer perception, leading to further reduction in
demand.&#160; Additional terrorist attacks,
the fear of such attacks or continued conflict in Iraq or other countries could
further affect the airline industry and could cause general instability in
financial markets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because a substantial portion of air travel, including business travel,
is discretionary, the industry tends to experience adverse financial results
during general economic downturns.&#160; Soft
economic conditions continue to put pressure on the profitability of the
industry.&#160; Any general decline in
passenger traffic may harm the Company&#146;s business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s operations are also subject to delays caused by factors
beyond its control, including air traffic congestion at airports, adverse
weather conditions and increased security measures.&#160; Such delays frustrate passengers, reduce
aircraft utilization and increase costs, all of which may affect profitability
and harm the Company&#146;s financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company is increasingly dependent upon technology in its
operations, and any failure of such technology could adversely affect the
Company.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has made, and will continue to make, substantial
investments in technology to manage its operations.&#160; In particular, the Company&#146;s systems
operations control center, which oversees daily flight operations, is dependent
on a number of technology systems to operate effectively.&#160; The Company&#146;s</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">technology systems may be vulnerable to various sources of interruption
due to events beyond the Company&#146;s control, including natural disasters,
terrorist attacks, computer viruses and hackers.&#160; In addition, large-scale interruption in
technology on which the Company depends, such as power, telecommunications or
the Internet, could substantially disrupt the Company&#146;s operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Any airline accident in which the Company is involved could subject the
Company to substantial liability and seriously harm the Company&#146;s financial
condition and results of operations.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">An accident involving Company aircraft could result in injuries and
loss of life, and the Company could experience significant claims from injured
persons and surviving relatives.&#160; An
accident could also result in substantial property damage, loss of aircraft
from service and adverse publicity for the Company.&#160; Airlines are required by the DOT to carry
liability insurance.&#160; Although the
Company believes its liability insurance is in amounts and of the type
generally consistent with industry practice, substantial claims resulting from
an accident in excess of insurance coverage would harm the Company&#146;s business
and financial results.&#160; Any resulting
claims would also be costly to defend and could harm the Company&#146;s
reputation.&#160; Moreover, any aircraft
accident, even if fully insured or not directly involving Mesaba or Big Sky,
could cause a public perception that flying is less safe or reliable than other
transportation alternatives, which could harm the Company&#146;s financial condition
and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company is subject to collective bargaining agreements with several
of its employee groups, and any failure to successfully negotiate these
agreements could subject the Company to strikes and increased labor costs,
either of which could negatively impact the Company&#146;s financial performance.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Labor costs are a significant component of the Company&#146;s expenses,
comprising 33.2% of total operating expenses in fiscal 2005.&#160; Several of the Company&#146;s employee groups have
separate bargaining agreements and may make demands that would increase
operating expenses, adversely affecting profitability.&#160; Mesaba is currently negotiating with AMFA for
a new agreement.&#160; The existing agreement
became amendable in August&nbsp;2003.&#160;
Mesaba is also currently negotiating with the TWU, whose agreement became
amendable in May&nbsp;2005.&#160; The Company
cannot predict the outcome of these negotiations.&#160; If the Company is unable to reach agreement
on the terms of any collective bargaining agreement or experiences widespread
employee dissatisfaction, there could be work slowdowns or stoppages.&#160; Any sustained work stoppages&nbsp;could
adversely affect Mesaba&#146;s ability to fulfill its obligations under the Airlink
Agreement and Jet Agreement and could have an adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks Related to the Company&#146;s Stock</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Together, certain of the Company&#146;s shareholders own or have the right
to acquire a significant portion of the Company&#146;s stock and could ultimately
control decisions regarding the Company.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest owns 27.5% of the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160; Northwest also owns warrants to purchase an
aggregate of 4,151,922 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160; Additionally, several other shareholders also
own significant blocks of the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160; Because the parties described above currently
own a large portion of the Company&#146;s stock, they may be able to determine or
significantly influence the outcome of corporate actions requiring shareholder
approval.&#160; As a result, these parties may
be in a position to control matters affecting the Company, including decisions
as to the Company&#146;s direction and policies; future issuances of securities;
incurrence of debt; amendments to the Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and
bylaws; payment of dividends on the Company&#146;s common stock; and acquisitions,
sales of the Company&#146;s assets, mergers or similar transactions, including
transactions involving a change of control.&#160;
As a result, some investors may be unwilling to purchase the Company&#146;s
common stock.&#160; In addition, if the demand
for the Company&#146;s common stock is reduced because of these</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">shareholders&#146; control of the Company, the price of the Company&#146;s common
stock could be materially depressed.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Future sales of the Company&#146;s common stock by its shareholders could
depress the price of the Company&#146;s stock.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales of a large number of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock or the
availability of a large number of shares for sale could adversely affect the
market price of the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160;
As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company had 20,574,340 shares of common
stock outstanding.&#160; Several of the
Company&#146;s shareholders own substantial blocks of the Company&#146;s common
stock.&#160; Additionally, along with the
shares of stock it currently owns, Northwest could own an additional large
block of the Company&#146;s common stock upon exercise of its warrants.&#160; In connection with the letter of intent with
Northwest, the Company has agreed to enter into a registration rights agreement
to register the shares of stock owned by Northwest (including those shares
underlying its warrants).&#160; Following such
registration, future sales of those shares, or future sales of other large
blocks of the Company&#146;s common stock that are already registered, could
substantially depress the Company&#146;s stock price.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Any future exercises of warrants by Northwest could substantially
dilute the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, Northwest holds warrants exercisable for an
aggregate of 4,151,922 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock at prices ranging
from $7.25 per share to $21.25 per share.&#160;
As described in the previous &#147;Recent Developments&#148; section, if the
Company enters into an omnibus airline services agreement, it expects to amend
these warrants to change the exercise price to $8.74 per share and to decrease
the number of shares issuable upon exercise to 4,112,500 shares.&#160; Holders of the Company&#146;s common stock,
therefore, could experience substantial ownership dilution if Northwest elects
to exercise these warrants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The Company&#146;s stock price may continue to be volatile.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the past two fiscal years, the market price of the Company&#146;s common
stock has ranged from a low of $5.52 per share to a high of $10.11 per
share.&#160; Because the Company&#146;s stock is
thinly traded, its market price is sensitive and may continue to experience
substantial fluctuations due to a variety of factors, including the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>failure
of the Company&#146;s operating results to meet analysts&#146; or investors&#146; expectations
in any quarter;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>securities
analysts&#146; estimates;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>material
announcements by the Company, Northwest or the Company&#146;s competitors;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>public
sales of a substantial number of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>regulatory
actions; or</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>general
market conditions.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Anti-takeover provisions of the Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and
bylaws and of Minnesota law could discourage, delay or prevent a change in
control.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and bylaws, along with
Minnesota law, could discourage, delay or prevent persons from acquiring or
attempting to acquire the Company.&#160; The
Company&#146;s articles of incorporation authorize the board of directors, without
action by the Company&#146;s shareholders, to designate and issue preferred stock in
one or more series, with such rights, preferences and privileges as the board
of directors shall determine.&#160; The
Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and bylaws also mandate</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a classified board of directors, which makes changing control of the
board more difficult.&#160; The Company&#146;s
bylaws grant the board of directors the authority to adopt, amend or repeal all
or any of such bylaws, subject to the power of the shareholders to change or
repeal such bylaws.&#160; The Company&#146;s bylaws
also limit who may call meetings of the Company&#146;s shareholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a public corporation, the Company is prohibited by the Minnesota
Business Corporation Act, except under certain specified circumstances, from
engaging in any merger, significant sale of stock or assets or business
combination with any shareholder or group of shareholders who own at least 10%
of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Available Information</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company maintains a website at www.mairholdings.com.&#160; On its website, free of charge, the Company
makes available its Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K and links to the SEC
website for other public filings.&#160; The
Company&#146;s Code of Ethics for its Chief Executive Officer and financial officers
is also available on its website.&#160; All
information is also available in print upon written request to the Company&#146;s
General Counsel at 150 South Fifth Street, Suite&nbsp;1360, Minneapolis, Minnesota
55402.&#160; The Company is not including the
information contained on or available through its website as a part of, or
incorporating such information by reference into, this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item2_Properties_055810"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 2.
PROPERTIES</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">69</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,400</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">410</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Saab 340</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">63</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30/33/34</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">300</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The RJ85 aircraft are pressurized jet airplanes with galleys, dual
class cabins, standup headroom, lavatories, airborne communications addressing
and reporting system, radar, ground proximity warning, traffic collision
avoidance and de-icing systems.&#160; The Saab
aircraft are pressurized jet-prop airplanes with galleys, standup headroom,
lavatories, radar, global positioning, ground proximity warning, traffic
collision avoidance and de-icing systems.&#160;
All of Mesaba&#146;s aircraft comply fully with all current regulations
issued by the FAA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases or subleases its RJ85 aircraft from Northwest under
operating leases with initial terms of up to ten years.&#160; The lease and sublease agreements for the
RJ85 with Northwest contain certain requirements of Mesaba regarding the
payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of
insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and the
condition of the aircraft upon their return to Northwest.&#160; The Jet Agreement allows Mesaba to return
aircraft to Northwest upon the occurrence of certain events, including
termination or breach of the Jet Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases its Saab aircraft, either directly from aircraft leasing
companies, through leases with Pinnacle under operating leases with initial
terms of up to seven years, or through subleases with Northwest under operating
leases with initial terms of up to 17 years.&#160;
The lease and sublease agreements with the aircraft leasing companies,
Pinnacle and Northwest contain certain requirements of Mesaba regarding the
payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of
insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and the
condition of the aircraft upon their return.&#160;
The Airlink Agreement allows Mesaba to return aircraft to Northwest upon
the occurrence of certain events, including termination of the Airlink
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, Mesaba&#146;s existing fleet of RJ85 and Saab
aircraft had remaining lease terms of up to 11 years.&#160; The current aggregate monthly lease payments
for all Mesaba aircraft is approximately $8.5 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth certain information as to Big Sky&#146;s
passenger aircraft fleet as of March&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">750</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">300</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beechcraft 1900D</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">750</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">325</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non Operating:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Metro III</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of Big Sky&#146;s aircraft are pressurized jet-prop airplanes with
radar, ground proximity warning, traffic collision avoidance and de-icing
systems.&#160; All of Big Sky&#146;s operating aircraft
comply fully with all current regulations issued by the FAA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
January&nbsp;2005, Big Sky entered into a letter of intent to lease ten
Beechcraft B1900D aircraft from Mesa Air Group,&nbsp;Inc., to transition from
its Metro fleet.&#160; During March&nbsp;2005,
Big Sky parked four Metros, took delivery of five </font>Beechcraft aircraft </font>and began flying them.&#160; Big Sky will take delivery of the remaining
five Beechcraft during fiscal 2006 and the Metro fleet will be removed from
service.&#160; Big Sky will attempt to dispose
of the Metro aircraft through subleases or other means.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky leases all of its Metro aircraft from leasing companies and its
Beechcraft aircraft from Mesa Air Group.&#160;
The lease agreements contain certain requirements of Big Sky regarding
the payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level
of insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and
the condition of the aircraft upon their return.&#160; The leases on five Metro aircraft allow Big
Sky to return the aircraft to the lessor upon the occurrence of certain events
and contain purchase options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, Big Sky&#146;s operating fleet of Metro and
Beechcraft aircraft had remaining lease terms of seven months to 60&nbsp;months
and aggregate monthly lease payments of approximately $0.2 million.&#160; The four nonoperating Metro aircraft are parked
and pending disposition as part of the fleet transition.&#160; The current aggregate monthly lease payments
for these nonoperating aircraft are approximately $50,000.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company
expensed</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
