<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">approximately $1.0 million related to the remaining lease payments on
the nonoperating aircraft and other estimated net costs of the aircraft&#146;s return
to the lessor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Facilities</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Holdings</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holdings&#146; executive offices are located in downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota.&#160; Holdings leases approximately 2,000 square
feet of office space for approximately $3,800 per month.&#160; The lease commenced in October&nbsp;2003.&#160; In May&nbsp;2005, Holdings entered into a new
lease in the same building for approximately 3,370 square feet of office space
with lease payments of approximately $6,000 per month.&#160; The lease expires on September&nbsp;30, 2010
but contains an early termination provision allowing the lease to be cancelled
on September&nbsp;30, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases an aircraft hangar facility from the Metropolitan
Airports Commission.&#160; Under this 25-year agreement,
Mesaba leases approximately 366,000 square feet of maintenance facilities,
maintenance offices, ramp, parking and unimproved land, of which approximately
87,000 square feet is for the new maintenance hangar facility.&#160; The lease payments of approximately $111,000
per month commenced in October&nbsp;2003.&#160;
Mesaba has a ten-year lease agreement for approximately 33,000 square
feet of office space for its principal executive offices located in Eagan,
Minnesota.&#160; The lease payments of
approximately $35,000 per month commenced in January&nbsp;2004.&#160; The lease expires on December&nbsp;31, 2013
but contains an early termination provision allowing the lease to be cancelled
at the end of seven years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba subleases approximately 21,000 square feet of office and
training support space at the Pan-Am International Flight Academy in Eagan,
Minnesota for its flight operations training center. &nbsp;Mesaba pays
approximately $27,000 per month under the terms of this sublease, which has a
term of 15 years and expires in January&nbsp;2017.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases approximately 497,000 square feet of facilities, ramp,
parking and unimproved land at the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky Airport under
separate ground and facilities leases.&#160;
The facilities lease covers approximately 126,000 square feet of hangar
and maintenance space, and Mesaba pays monthly rentals of approximately $92,000
until July&nbsp;1, 2029 as part of a special facilities bond financing provided
by the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky Airport Authority.&#160; Pursuant to the guaranty agreement, Holdings
unconditionally guarantees full and prompt payment of the bonds.&#160; The ground lease has a 30-year term
concurrent with the facilities lease.&#160; Mesaba
pays approximately $12,000 per month under the ground lease.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases approximately 334,000 square feet of ramp, parking and
unimproved land at the Detroit Metropolitan Airport.&#160; The hangar facility, of approximately 60,000 square
feet, located on the property was paid in full in fiscal 2003.&#160; The ground lease has a 20-year term with
monthly lease payments of approximately $10,000.&#160; Lease payments are subject to an annual
adjustment on January&nbsp;1 each year based upon the percentage change in an
index published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the U.S. Department of
Commerce.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases approximately 38,000 square feet of hangar and office
space located on approximately 102,000 square feet of land and parking areas of
which Mesaba is ground lessee at the Central Wisconsin Airport in Mosinee,
Wisconsin.&#160; Mesaba pays approximately
$3,000 per month under the terms of the ground and facility lease, which expire
on December&nbsp;31, 2011, subject to two ten-year renewal options.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s main hangar and principal offices are located at the Logan
International Airport in Billings, Montana.&#160;
The main facility consists of a 12,000 square foot building that can
hold three aircraft for maintenance, a parts warehouse, back shop area and two
floors of offices.&#160; A two-story building
adjacent to the hangar houses Big Sky&#146;s general offices.&#160; These buildings are situated on approximately
83,000 square feet of land owned by the City of Billings and leased to Big Sky
on long-term facility and ground leases.&#160;
The facility lease has a 20-year term and the ground lease has a 26-year
term.&#160; The combined monthly lease payment
is approximately $7,000.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item3_LegalProceedings_055822"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 3.
LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;4, 2002, Fairbrook Leasing,&nbsp;Inc.,
Lambert Leasing,&nbsp;Inc. and Swedish Aircraft Holdings AB (&#147;Saab Leasing&#148;)
filed a declaratory judgment action against Mesaba relating to 20 Saab 340A (&#147;340A&#148;)
aircraft leased by Mesaba.&nbsp; Saab Leasing sought a judicial declaration
that the terms of the leases applicable to each of the 340A aircraft are
governed by a March&nbsp;7, 1996 term sheet proposal rather than the parties&#146;
subsequent agreements and conduct.&nbsp; In a December&nbsp;8, 2003 order, the
District Court declared the term sheet proposal a binding preliminary agreement
requiring Mesaba to negotiate in good faith toward the execution of long-term
agreements for each of the 340A aircraft.&nbsp; Mesaba appealed the District
Court&#146;s ruling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;13, 2004, relying on the
District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling, Saab Leasing filed a separate
action in the District Court alleging approximately $35 million in damages for
past due and future aircraft lease obligations.&nbsp; Mesaba denies the
allegations in Saab Leasing&#146;s complaint and contends that it has fulfilled and
will continue to fulfill its existing obligations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;19, 2005, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit
affirmed the District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling.&nbsp; Despite the
Eighth Circuit&#146;s ruling, Mesaba believes, based on advice from its legal
counsel, that it has defenses in the damages case that will limit Saab Leasing&#146;s
ability to recover damages.&nbsp; Nevertheless, there can be no assurance that
the District Court in the damages case will agree with Mesaba&#146;s analysis.&nbsp;
Therefore, the ultimate outcome of this dispute cannot be predicted with
certainty.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company did not establish an accrual
with regard to this litigation.&#160;
Accordingly, an adverse outcome to this matter could have a material
impact on the Company&#146;s financial condition and results of operation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_055825"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 4. SUBMISSION OF MATTERS TO A VOTE OF SECURITY HOLDERS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There were no matters submitted to a vote of the Company&#146;s shareholders
during the three month period ended March&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Partii_055831"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;II</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item5_MarketForRegistrantsCommonE_055834"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT&#146;S COMMON EQUITY AND RELATED SHAREHOLDER MATTERS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s common stock is traded under the symbol &#147;MAIR&#148; on the
NASDAQ National Market.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\JMS\mallena\05-8337-1\task467907\8337-1-ba-01.htm',USER='mallen',CD='Jun 14 13:09 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth, for the periods indicated, the high and
low price per share for the Company&#146;s common stock for the two most recent fiscal
years.&#160; Quotations for such periods are
as reported by NASDAQ for National Market issues.&#160; The Company has not issued cash dividends
since September&nbsp;1995 and does not currently intend to do so in the future.</font></p>

  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.94%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.38%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;1, 2005, the number of holders of record of common stock
was 648.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The transfer agent for the Company&#146;s common stock is Wells Fargo Bank
Minnesota, National Association, 161 North Concord Exchange, South St. Paul,
Minnesota, 55075-0738, telephone: (651)&nbsp;450-4064.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="179" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="12" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="145" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The equity compensation plans approved by the Company&#146;s shareholders
are the 1994 Stock Option Plan, the 1996 Director Stock Option Plan and the
2000 Stock Incentive Plan.&#160; The 2000 Stock
Incentive Plan contains a provision that automatically increases the authorized
shares available for grant on September&nbsp;1 of each year by the lesser of
300,000 or 1% of the then outstanding common shares.&#160; See Item 8, &#147;Financial Statements and
Supplementary Data&#148; Note 9, for additional information regarding the Company&#146;s
equity compensation plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item6_SelectedFinancialData_070109"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 6.
SELECTED FINANCIAL DATA</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following tables set forth selected financial data with respect to
the Company as of the dates and for the periods indicated.&#160; The selected financial data has been derived
from the Company&#146;s audited consolidated financial statements, which have been restated
to give effect to the restatement discussed in Note&nbsp;14 to the Company&#146;s
Consolidated Financial Statements.&#160; The
financial data set forth below should be read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s
Consolidated Financial Statements and Notes thereto and &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion
and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#148; contained in
Item 7.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Balance sheet data
includes Big Sky, which was acquired on December&nbsp;1, 2002.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8,415</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Available seat miles
(&#147;ASM&#148;) are determined by multiplying the number of seats available for
passengers by the number of miles flown. &#160;Amounts are in thousands.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Revenue passenger
miles are determined by multiplying the number of fare paying passengers
carried by the distance flown.&#160; Amounts
are in thousands.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Load factor is
determined by dividing revenue passenger miles by available seat miles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Selected operating
data for Big Sky is from the date of acquisition, December&nbsp;1, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAna_061416"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 7. MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND
RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations</font>
has been restated to give effect to the restatement discussed in Note&nbsp;14 to
the consolidated financial statements included in Item&nbsp;8, and should be read
in conjunction with the accompanying consolidated financial statements.&#160; The Company&#146;s operations and financial
results are subject to various risks and uncertainties associated with the
airline industry.&#160; See &#147;Certain Risk
Factors Relating to the Company and the Airline Industry&#148; in Item 2.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year in Review and Outlook</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2005 was a rebuilding year for the Company.&#160; After Mesaba reached a new pilot agreement
that extends through January&nbsp;2009 and reaffirmed the Jet Agreement with
Northwest through April&nbsp;2007 in late fiscal 2004, Mesaba brought the five
grounded RJ85s back into service in the first quarter of fiscal</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005 and increased the utilization of that fleet.&#160; Traffic built steadily in the summer, but
Mesaba subsequently faced some very challenging weather and irregular
operations in its hubs, especially in Detroit, during the Christmas and winter
periods.&#160; Mesaba also focused on process
discipline in the ground handling at its hub operations and began providing CRJ
deicing and online luggage transfer for Northwest at Detroit. &#160;By March, Mesaba was focused on responding to
a request for proposal from Northwest for new 50 seat regional jet
operations.&#160; Separately, Big Sky
initiated a fleet transition of its own from the Metros to the Beechcraft 1900D.&#160; Big Sky completed a new fleet campaign by
putting the Beechcraft 1900D on its air carrier certificate in 60 days.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Outlook</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Given the airline industry&#146;s continued economic uncertainty, the
Company&#146;s will focus its efforts in fiscal 2006 on three main strategies:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Maintain
outstanding operating performance at each subsidiary while the subsidiaries focus
on the following initiatives:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mesaba
will focus on finalizing a new omnibus airline services agreement with
Northwest, obtaining its CRJ certificate and bringing 15 new aircraft into the
fleet, starting in October&nbsp;2005 with expected completion by March&nbsp;2006</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mesaba
will continue to negotiate a new contract with its mechanics and dispatchers
while simultaneously building contingency plans to ensure safe, reliable
operations during potential labor unrest at Northwest or Mesaba</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Big
Sky will complete its fleet transition, retiring the remaining Metros from
operations, and expand its route structure by bringing five additional Beechcraft
1900Ds into the fleet</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Invest
in a new fleet at Mesaba which should improve the Company&#146;s financial position and
operating results in fiscal 2007 and beyond</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Explore
additional growth opportunities with existing subsidiaries and consider
acquisitions to diversify in the airline industry.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal Year Ended March&nbsp;31, 2005 Compared with Fiscal Year Ended March&nbsp;31,
2004</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Earnings Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reported net income of $7.4&nbsp;million or $0.35 per
diluted share for fiscal 2005, compared to $4.5&nbsp;million or $0.22 per
diluted share in fiscal 2004.&#160; Diluted weighted
average common and potentially dilutive common shares were 21.1&nbsp;million
and 20.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005 and 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba Operating Revenues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating revenues increased 1.9% in fiscal 2005 to $441.0&nbsp;million
from $432.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160;
The increase is primarily attributable to incremental ground handling
revenue due to Mesaba&#146;s increased ground handling business in Minneapolis and
Detroit.&#160; This was partially offset by a
0.4% decrease in passenger revenue as the reduction in Saab flying more than
offset the incremental RJ85 flying year-over-year.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba Operating Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses in fiscal 2005 increased 1.0% to $426.5&nbsp;million
from $422.2&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160;
The cost per ASM decreased 4.1% to $0.139 from $0.145.&#160; The following table compares components of
operating cost per ASM for the years ended March&nbsp;31:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="61%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:61.0%;">

  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.32%;">

  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.92%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">

  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.9</font></p>

  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.32%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Wages and benefits increased 5.6% to $140.9&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005
from $133.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160;
Wages and benefits increased due to increased ground handling wages from
additional ground handling activity, increased wages due to additional flying
and the new pilots&#146; contract and increased costs related to the 401(k) benefit plan.&#160; These increases were slightly offset by lower
health and dental expenses resulting from improved experience. &#160;Year-over-year comparisons were also affected
by the one-time $2.7 million retroactive pilot compensation expense in the
prior year resulting from the pilots&#146; contract signed in January&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft fuel decreased 16.0% to $16.9&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005 from
$20.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160; The
decrease is partially attributable to a decrease of 6.5% in Saab block hours
flown.&#160; In addition, there was a $1.8
million decrease due to adjustments made to previously recorded accruals for estimated
fuel expense.&#160; Certain provisions of the
Airlink Agreement with Northwest protect Mesaba from changes in fuel
prices.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s actual cost of fuel,
including taxes and pumping fees, was 83.5 cents per gallon in both fiscal 2005
and 2004.&#160; Northwest is responsible for
fuel for Mesaba&#146;s RJ85 operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft maintenance costs, excluding wages and benefits, increased 5.8%
to $81.9&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005 from $77.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160; Aircraft maintenance costs increased primarily
due to a 9.5% increase in RJ85 block hours in fiscal 2005 and repair costs
incurred to continue to maintain the fleet as it ages.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft rents decreased 2.2% to $100.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005
from $102.7&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160;
This decrease is attributable to four fewer Saab aircraft in service
year-over-year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Landing fees decreased 3.9% to $6.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005 from $6.8&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2004.&#160; The decrease is
primarily attributable to the 7.1% reduction of Saab departures partially
offset by airport rate increases during fiscal 2005.&#160; Northwest is responsible for landing fees for
Mesaba&#146;s RJ85 operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Insurance and taxes decreased 26.4% to $6.2&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005
from $8.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160;
The decrease is primarily attributable to fewer insured aircraft and a
reduction in the rates charged for hull and passenger liability insurance, as
well as the recognition of property tax refunds of $0.7 million.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization decreased 15.1% to $13.8&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2005 compared to $16.3&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160; The lower level of depreciation and
amortization resulted from reduced capital spending over the last several years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Administrative and other expenses increased 5.0% to $59.9&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2005 from $57.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004 primarily due to
increased outside services of $3.6 million related to consulting and audit costs
incurred to comply with the requirements of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and increased
TSA fees.&#160; In addition, the increase was
due to costs associated with irregular operations of approximately $1.2 million.&#160; These increased costs were offset by reduced
costs related to third party Saab ground handling of $1.1 million and pilot
training of $1.4 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky Operating Revenues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating revenues decreased 8.5% to $15.1 million in fiscal 2005
from $16.5 million in fiscal 2004 due to a reduction in flying unprofitable
routes, resulting in a $1.7 million decrease in passenger revenue, partially
offset by a $0.3 million increase in EAS subsidies.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky Operating Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses in fiscal 2005 decreased 0.5% to $20.0 million
from $20.1 million in fiscal 2004 primarily due to the reduced flying
year-over-year, which were offset by $1.0 million costs associated with the
permanent grounding of four Metro aircraft: three due to the fleet transition
from Metros to Beechcraft 1900Ds and one due to significant aircraft damage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Operating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating income totaled $8.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005, as compared
to $4.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160; The
Company&#146;s operating margin increased to 1.9% in fiscal 2005 from 0.9% in fiscal
2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Nonoperating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nonoperating income (net) decreased to $2.3&nbsp;million for fiscal 2005
from $4.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160; The
decrease is primarily due to the government grant of $2.6 million in fiscal
2004, which was partially offset by increased interest income of $0.6 million earned
on the Company&#146;s investments in fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Provision for Income Taxes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision for income taxes decreased 9.1% to $3.6&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2005 from $4.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004.&#160; The Company&#146;s blended effective tax rate was
32.9% in fiscal 2005 as compared to 46.8% in fiscal 2004.&#160; During the first quarter of fiscal 2005, the
Company received verification of a final settlement with the Internal Revenue
Service concerning its examination of the Company&#146;s fiscal 1995 and 1996 income
tax returns.&#160; As a result of this
settlement, the Company reduced its income tax payable and tax provision by
$1.2 million.&#160; Without this one-time
adjustment, the Company&#146;s effective tax rate would have been 43.8% in fiscal
2005.&#160; The Company adjusts its effective
tax rate quarterly based on forecasted operating results in the fiscal
year.&#160; <font face="Times New Roman">The rate is
affected principally by the level of nondeductible expenses relative to
projected taxable income.</font></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal Year Ended March&nbsp;31, 2004 Compared with Fiscal Year Ended March&nbsp;31,
2003</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Earnings Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reported net income of $4.5&nbsp;million or $0.22 per
diluted share for fiscal 2004, compared to $4.2&nbsp;million or $0.20 per
diluted share in fiscal 2003.&#160; Diluted
weighted average common and potentially dilutive common shares outstanding were
20.6&nbsp;million and 20.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004 and 2003.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;1, 2002, the Company acquired all the outstanding
shares of Big Sky and accounted for the transaction using the purchase method
of accounting.&#160; The Company has
consolidated Big Sky&#146;s results of operations from the acquisition date to March&nbsp;31,
2004.&#160; For fiscal 2004, Big Sky generated
operating revenues of $16.5&nbsp;million and operating expenses of
$20.1&nbsp;million.&#160; Due to the fact that
year-over-year and full year information for Big Sky is not included, a
detailed discussion of Big Sky&#146;s operating results and statistics is not
presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba Operating Revenues</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating revenues decreased 4.1% in fiscal 2004 to
$432.6&nbsp;million from $451.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; The decrease is attributable to a decrease of
approximately 6.7% in completed Saab ASMs due to the return of six Saab A-model
aircraft, the grounding of five RJ85 aircraft from December&nbsp;2003 to March&nbsp;2004
and the temporary shutdown of service during final pilot negotiations in January&nbsp;2004
that resulted in the cancellation of 624 flights.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba Operating Expenses</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses in fiscal 2004 decreased 3.6% to $422.5&nbsp;million
from $438.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160;
The cost per ASM decreased 6.9% to $0.145 from $0.155.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table compares components of operating cost per ASM for
the years ended March&nbsp;31:</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.2</font></p>

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="58%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:58.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Insurance and taxes</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="58%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:58.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="58%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:58.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Administrative and other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="58%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:58.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.46%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Wages and benefits increased 1.7% to $133.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004
from $131.3&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160;
The increase is primarily the result of the new ALPA contract, which
included $2.7 million in retroactive pay, which was partially offset by
productivity improvement in maintenance and customer service.&#160; Also contributing to the variance were significant
increases in health and dental insurance and workers&#146; compensation costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft fuel decreased 8.2% to $20.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004 from
$21.9&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; The
decrease is attributable primarily to a decrease of 6.6% in the number of Saab
block hours flown, favorable fuel burn rates and fuel credits received in
fiscal 2004.&#160; Certain provisions of the
Airlink Agreement with Northwest protect Mesaba from changes in fuel prices.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s actual cost of fuel, including taxes
and pumping fees, was 83.5 cents per gallon in both fiscal 2004 and 2003.&#160; Northwest is responsible for fuel for Mesaba&#146;s
RJ85 operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft maintenance costs, excluding wages and benefits, decreased
5.5% to $77.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004 from $81.9&nbsp;million in fiscal
2003.&#160; Aircraft maintenance costs
decreased primarily due to a 2.3% reduction in flight hours flown in fiscal
2004 and a reduction in aircraft damage expenses.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft rents decreased 3.7% to $103.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004
from $107.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160;
This decrease is attributable to fewer aircraft in service
year-over-year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Landing fees decreased 5.3% to $6.8&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004 from
$7.2&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; The
decrease is primarily attributable to the reduction of Saab departures during
fiscal 2004.&#160; Northwest is responsible
for landing fees for Mesaba&#146;s RJ85 operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Insurance and taxes decreased 43.2% to $8.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004
from $14.7&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160;
The decrease is primarily attributable to a reduction in the rates
charged for hull and passenger liability insurance and favorable property tax
credits.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization decreased 12.2% to $16.3&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2004 compared to $18.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; The lower level of depreciation and
amortization resulted from reduced capital spending over the last several
years.&#160; The reduction is because less
capital expenditure is required to maintain the fleet versus investing in the
infrastructure to grow the fleet in previous fiscal years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Administrative and other expenses remained relatively constant,
increasing 2.2% to $57.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004 from $55.8&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Operating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating income totaled $4.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2004, as compared
to $8.3&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; The
Company&#146;s operating margin decreased to 0.9% in fiscal 2004 from 1.8% in fiscal
2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Nonoperating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nonoperating income (net) increased to $4.4&nbsp;million for fiscal 2004
from $0.3&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160;
Fiscal 2004 nonoperating income represents a government grant of $2.6
million and interest income earned on the Company&#146;s investments.&#160; Fiscal 2003 nonoperating income represents
the offsetting impact of the recognition of a $3.0&nbsp;million writedown of an
investment in a WorldCom bond and interest income earned on the Company&#146;s
remaining investments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Provision for Income Taxes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision for income taxes decreased 10.7% to $4.0&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2004 from $4.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; The Company&#146;s blended effective tax rate was
46.8% in fiscal 2004 as compared to 51.7% in fiscal 2003.&#160; The effective tax rate decreased primarily
due to deducting certain meals and entertainment expenses that were previously
treated as nondeductible expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash, cash equivalents and short and long-term investments increased 6.9%
to $170.9&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2005 from $159.9&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31,
2004.&#160; The Company&#146;s working capital increased
to $105.3&nbsp;million with a current ratio of 2.3 at March&nbsp;31, 2005
compared to $97.8&nbsp;million and 2.3 at March&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investments consist principally of municipal securities and are
classified as available-for-sale.&#160;
Available-for-sale investments are reported at fair value with
unrealized gains and losses excluded from operations and reported as a separate
component of shareholders&#146; equity, except for other-than-temporary impairments,
which are reported as a charge to current operations and result in a new cost
basis for the investment.&#160; The Company
classifies investments with an original maturity of more than 90 days that
mature within one year as short-term and greater than one year as long-term.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reclassified its investments in auction rate securities
from cash and cash equivalents to short or long-term investments in the
accompanying consolidated balance sheets depending upon the original maturity
date.&#160; These auction rate securities, which
have interest rate resets every 90 days or less but maturity dates of greater
than 90 days, were previously included in cash and cash equivalents in the
amount of $1.9 million at March&nbsp;31, 2004.&#160;
The auction rate securities are classified as available-for-sale and are
carried at cost, which approximates market value.&#160; The reclassifications had no impact on the
Company&#146;s previously reported results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately 83.0% of the Company&#146;s accounts receivable balance as of March&nbsp;31,
2005 was due from Northwest and this receivable is not collateralized.&#160; The Company&#146;s business is sensitive to events
and risks affecting Northwest.&#160; Northwest
has incurred significant losses in the last several years, including a net loss
of $862 million in 2004 and a net loss of $450 million in the first quarter of
2005.&#160; If Northwest continues to incur
operating losses, it may be unable to fulfill its financial obligations,
including payments due to Mesaba under the Airlink Agreement and Jet Agreement.&#160; Loss of Mesaba&#146;s affiliation with Northwest
or Northwest&#146;s failure to make timely payment of amounts owed to Mesaba or to
otherwise materially perform under the Airlink or Jet Agreement for any reason
would have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s results of operations and
financial condition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash and cash equivalents increased 10.1% to $58.0&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31,
2005 from $52.7&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2004.&#160; A summary of cash flow activity is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by operations in fiscal 2005 was $22.1 million.&#160; The primary sources of cash were from
operations, which generated $7.4 million of net income and $15.6 million of non-cash
items, primarily depreciation and amortization.&#160;
The changes to current operating items resulted in a use of cash of $0.9
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Investing Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used by investing activities in fiscal 2005 was $17.9
million.&#160; Cash that was generated from
operations was the funding source for investing activities.&#160; The primary uses were net purchases of short
and long-term investments of $8.2 million and purchases of property, plant and
equipment of $9.7 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Financing Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by financing activities in fiscal 2005 was $1.1
million.&#160; This was primary due to the
repayment of noncurrent liabilities of $0.1 million, which was offset by the
proceeds from the issuance of common stock related to the exercise of options of
$1.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Outlook</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has historically relied on cash and cash equivalents,
investments and internally generated funds to support its working capital
requirements.&#160; Absent adverse factors
outside the control of the Company, management believes current liquidity and
funds from operations will provide adequate resources for meeting current
operations, investment in the new CRJ fleet and non-aircraft capital needs for
fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Contractual Obligations, Commitments and Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, Mesaba&#146;s fleet consisted of 98 aircraft
covered under operating leases with remaining terms of up to 11 years and
aggregate monthly lease payments of approximately $8.5&nbsp;million.&#160; Mesaba leases its Saab aircraft, either
directly from aircraft leasing companies, through Pinnacle under operating
leases with initial terms of up to seven years or through subleases with
Northwest under</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">operating leases with initial terms of up to 17 years.&#160; Mesaba leases its RJ85 aircraft from
Northwest under operating leases with initial terms of up to ten years.&#160; Mesaba believes that its revenues from the
Airlink and Jet Agreements will continue to be sufficient to fund its aircraft
lease obligations.&#160; If the Airlink
Agreement terminates, then the Saab aircraft leases will simultaneously terminate.&#160; Likewise, if the Jet Agreement terminates,
then the RJ85 aircraft leases will simultaneously terminate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, Big Sky&#146;s fleet consisted of 13 aircraft
covered under operating leases with remaining terms of seven months to
60&nbsp;months and aggregate monthly lease payments of approximately
$0.2&nbsp;million.&#160; Big Sky leases eight
of its aircraft from leasing companies and five from Air Midwest, a subsidiary
of Mesa Air Group.&#160; Big Sky will lease an
additional five Beechcraft 1900Ds in fiscal 2006.&#160; Five of the Metro leases allow Big Sky to
return the aircraft to the lessor upon the occurrence of certain events and
contain purchase options.&#160; Funding of the
monthly minimum lease payments is dependent on continued passenger boardings,
Big Sky&#146;s operations and, potentially, funding from the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s airline fleet operating leases do not contain any
guaranteed lease residual provisions for which there would be a potential
contingency at the termination of the lease period.&#160; The following table summarizes the Company&#146;s
commitments to make long-term debt and lease payments for the years ending March&nbsp;31,
in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>
