  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.35</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.22</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.20</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pro forma</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.29</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.21</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.07</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue Recognition</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba recognizes revenue for each completed available seat mile under
the Airlink Agreement and for each block hour flown under the Jet
Agreement.&#160; Passenger, freight and other
revenues are recognized as income when the respective services are rendered.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='46',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:24 2005' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the Airlink and Jet Agreements with Northwest include
semi-annual incentive payments based on achievement of certain operational
targets, such as completion factor and on time performance.&#160; Such incentives are earned and due based upon
performance over a given period (generally six months).&#160; In periods prior to the finalization of such
operational incentives, revenue is recognized when the targets have been
exceeded.&#160; The amount recognized is
limited to a ratable portion of the incentive payment as if the contract period
were to terminate at the end of the interim period.&#160; Such incentives totaled $3.1 million, $4.6 million
and $5.2 million in fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003 and are included in passenger
revenues in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky recognizes revenue when transportation has been provided,
including scheduled passenger, airfreight, express package and charter
services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Taxes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for income taxes under the asset and liability
method whereby deferred income tax assets and liabilities are computed annually
for differences between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and
liabilities.&#160; These differences will
result in taxable or deductible amounts in the future based on enacted tax laws
and rates applicable to the periods in which the differences are expected to
affect taxable income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Fair Value of Financial Instruments</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s financial instruments consist primarily of cash, cash
equivalents, accounts receivable, accounts payable, accrued liabilities and
other noncurrent liabilities of which carrying amounts do not significantly
differ from fair value due to their either short-term nature or variable
interest rates. &#160;See Note 5 for
additional information regarding the Company&#146;s investments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Reclassifications</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain balances in the prior years&#146; consolidated financial statements
have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation.&#160; These reclassifications had no impact on net
income or shareholders&#146; equity as previously reported.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">New Accounting Pronouncements</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
December&nbsp;2004, the FASB issued SFAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;123(R), &#147;Share-Based Payment,&#148; which requires
all public companies accounting for share-based payment transactions to account
for these types of transactions using a fair-value-based method.&#160; SFAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;123(R) eliminates the
ability to account for share-based compensation transactions using APB Opinion No.&nbsp;25.&#160; SFAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;123(R) also requires the
tax benefits associated with these shared based payments to be classified as
financing activities in the statement of cash flows rather than operating
activities as is currently permitted.&#160;
SFAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;123(R) becomes effective </font>as of the beginning
of the first<b><font style="font-weight:bold;"> </font></b>fiscal year beginning after June&nbsp;15,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company expects to adopt SFAS No.&nbsp;123(R) on April&nbsp;1, 2006 using the
modified-prospective method.&#160; Under this
transition method, the Company will record compensation expense for all awards
it grants on a straight-line basis over the vesting period.&#160; In addition, the Company will record
compensation expense for the unvested portion of previously granted awards that
remain outstanding at the date of the adoption.&#160;
The Company has not completed its assessment of the impact of the
standard on its financial condition or results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Acquisition:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;26, 2002, the Company executed a definitive merger
agreement providing for the acquisition of Big Sky for $3.2 million, net of
cash acquired of $0.3 million.&#160; The
transaction closed on December&nbsp;1, 2002.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='47',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company funded the acquisition with cash from operations and accounted for the
acquisition using the purchase method of accounting.&#160; Accordingly, the purchase price was allocated
to the assets acquired and liabilities assumed based on their estimated fair
market values at the date of acquisition.&#160;
Assets and liabilities are recorded based upon their fair value as of
the date of the acquisition.&#160; The excess
of the purchase price over the fair value of the net assets acquired was
allocated to certain identifiable intangible assets and goodwill.&#160; Such goodwill is not deductible for income
tax purposes.&#160; Results of Big Sky&#146;s
operations have been included in the accompanying consolidated financial
statements since the date of acquisition.&#160;
Due to the lack of materiality of Big Sky&#146;s operations, pro forma
financial results are not presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Goodwill
and Other Intangible Assets:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
excess of the Big Sky purchase price over the fair market value of the net assets
acquired was allocated to certain identifiable intangible assets, including Big
Sky&#146;s pilot labor contract and an air carrier certificate, and to
goodwill.&#160; The intangible assets were initially
recorded based upon preliminary estimates.&#160;
A net reduction of $0.7 million was recorded to goodwill after the purchase
price allocation was finalized in fiscal 2004.&#160;
Goodwill and other intangible assets and related accumulated
amortization were as follows for the years ended March&nbsp;31, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="88%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:88.0%;">

  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The amortizable intangible asset is being amortized over its estimated
period of benefit.&#160; Based on the current
amount of intangible assets subject to amortization, estimated amortization
expense for each of the succeeding five fiscal years will be $0.4 million per
year.&#160; The recoverability of goodwill and
the intangible assets is evaluated annually, at a minimum, or on an interim
basis if events or circumstances indicate a possible inability to realize the
carrying amounts.&#160; During the fourth
quarter of fiscal 2005, the Company completed its annual impairment test of
goodwill and other intangible assets and determined that no impairment charge
was necessary.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Investments:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investments consist principally of municipal securities and are
classified as available-for-sale.&#160; Fair
value of investments are determined based on quoted market prices.&#160; The Company classifies investments with an
original maturity of more than 90 days that mature within one year as short-term
and greater than one year as long-term.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reclassified its investments in auction rate securities from
cash and cash equivalents to short or long-term investments in the accompanying
consolidated balance sheets depending upon the original maturity date.&#160; These auction rate securities, which have
interest rate resets every 90 days or less</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='48',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">but maturity dates of greater than 90 days, were previously included in
cash and cash equivalents in the amounts of $1.9 million and $8.4 million at March&nbsp;31,
2004 and 2003.&#160; The auction rate
securities are classified as available-for-sale and are carried at cost, which
approximates market value. &#160;The
reclassifications had no impact on the Company&#146;s previously reported results of
operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the accompanying consolidated statements of cash flows
have been revised to reflect the purchases and sales of these investments as
part of cash flows from investing activities. &#160;In fiscal 2004, the reclassification resulted
in an increase in purchases of investments of $4.6 million and an increase in sales
of investments of $11.1 million, resulting in an increase of net cash used in
investing activities of $6.5 million in the consolidated statements of cash
flows.&#160; In fiscal 2003, the
reclassification resulted in an increase in purchases of investments of $14.1
million and an increase in sales of investments of $5.7 million, resulting in a
decrease in net cash used in investing activities of $8.4 million in the
consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Amortized cost, gross unrealized gains and losses and fair value of short
and long-term investments classified as securities available for sale were as
follows for the years ended March&nbsp;31, in thousands</font>:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gross unrealized losses</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">112,909</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">107,269</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.78%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal 2005 and 2004, the gross realized gains and losses were
insignificant as the Company generally held the investments until maturity.&#160; In fiscal 2003, the Company recorded realized
gains of $0.6 million and realized losses of $0.1 million.&#160; In fiscal 2003, the Company recorded an
other-than-temporary impairment loss of $3.0&nbsp;million on its investment in
a WorldCom bond.&#160; In March&nbsp;2003, the
Company sold its investment in WorldCom for $0.8&nbsp;million, which resulted
in a gain of approximately $0.4&nbsp;million, which was recorded in interest
income and other in the consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Leases:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Aircraft Leases</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s airline fleet consisted of the following aircraft held under
operating leases as of March&nbsp;31, 2005:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the terms of the Jet Agreement, Mesaba leases or subleases its
RJ85 aircraft from Northwest under operating leases with initial terms of up to
ten years.&#160; The RJ85 lease and sublease
agreements with Northwest contain certain requirements of Mesaba regarding the
payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of
insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and the
condition of the aircraft upon their return to Northwest.&#160; The Jet Agreement allows</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='49',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba to return aircraft to Northwest upon the occurrence of certain
events, including termination or breach of the Jet Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases its Saab 340 aircraft either directly from aircraft
leasing companies, through leases with Pinnacle Airlines Corp. (&#147;Pinnacle&#148;)
under operating leases with initial terms of up to seven years or through
subleases with Northwest under operating leases with initial terms of up to 17 years.&#160; The lease and sublease agreements with the
aircraft leasing companies, Pinnacle and Northwest contain certain requirements
of Mesaba regarding the payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the
aircraft, the level of insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures
to be performed and the condition of the aircraft upon their return.&#160; The Airlink Agreement allows Mesaba to return
aircraft to Northwest upon the occurrence of certain events including
termination or breach of the Airlink Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s airline fleet consisted of the following aircraft held under
operating leases as of March&nbsp;31, 2005:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s fleet consisted of 13 aircraft covered under operating leases
with remaining terms of seven months to 60&nbsp;months and aggregate monthly
lease payments of approximately $0.2&nbsp;million.&#160; Big Sky leases eight of its aircraft from
leasing companies and five from Air Midwest, a subsidiary of Mesa Air
Group.&#160; Big Sky will lease an additional
five Beechcraft 1900Ds in fiscal 2006.&#160; Five
of the Metro leases allow Big Sky to return the aircraft to the lessor upon the
occurrence of certain events and contain purchase options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s airline fleet operating leases do not contain any
guaranteed lease residual provisions for which there would be a potential
contingency at the termination of the lease period.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, the aircraft
operating leases for Mesaba and Big Sky require future minimum rental payments
as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='50',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent expense for aircraft operating leases totaled $102.5 million, $105.5
million and $107.8 million in fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003 (including $59.5
million, $66.0 million and $69.1 million paid to Northwest in fiscal 2005, 2004
and 2003).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Aircraft Leases</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases land, offices, hangar facilities, equipment and
certain terminal facilities under operating leases through 2019, which provide
for approximate future minimum rental payments as follows as of March&nbsp;31,
2005, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent expense for non-aircraft operating leases totaled approximately
$15.4 million, $16.2 million and $11.3 million in fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The carrying value of the facility under capital lease net of
accumulated depreciation was $0.5 million at both March&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.18%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:20.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="73%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:73.96%;">

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.18%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">237</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other Guarantees</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba has letters of credit to guarantee certain obligations, which
totaled $3.4 million and $1.6 million as of March&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004.&#160; There were no amounts drawn on these letters
of credit during fiscal 2005 or 2004.&#160; As
collateral for these letters of credit, Mesaba had $3.6 million in cash held in
an investment account as of both March&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004.&#160; This amount is restricted and has been
classified within &#147;Long-term investments&#148; in the accompanying consolidated
balance sheets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky Airport under a facilities lease
that covers approximately 126,000 square feet of hangar and maintenance space,
Mesaba pays monthly rentals of approximately $92,000 until July&nbsp;1, 2029 as
part of a special facilities bond financing provided by the Cincinnati/Northern
Kentucky Airport Authority.&#160; Pursuant to
the guaranty agreement, Holdings unconditionally guarantees full and prompt
payment of the bonds.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

Taxes:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

for the years ended March&nbsp;31, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred income taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary
differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for
financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for income tax purposes.&#160; At March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company&#146;s
deferred tax assets included $3.7 million of Big Sky NOL carryforwards that
will expire through 2022.&#160; Section&nbsp;382
of the Internal Revenue Code restricts the annual utilization of certain NOLs
incurred prior to a change in ownership.&#160;
However, such limitation is not expected to impair the realization of
these NOLs.&#160; For financial reporting
purposes, the Company believes it is more likely than not that the NOLs and
other deferred tax assets will be realized based on the Company&#146;s projected
future taxable income and the timing of the expiring NOLs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shareholders&#146;
Equity:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Capital Stock</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s authorized capital stock consists of 60,000,000 shares of
common stock, par value $0.01 per share, and 1,000,000 shares of undesignated
preferred stock, having no specified par value.&#160;
As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, there were 20,574,340 shares of common stock
issued and outstanding.&#160; No shares of
preferred stock have been issued.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holders of common stock are entitled to one vote per share on any
matter presented to shareholders for approval.&#160;
The common stock has no special voting rights or dividend
preferences.&#160; Holders of common stock are
not allowed cumulative voting and do not possess any preemptive rights to
acquire any new or additional shares of stock of the Company.&#160; Dividends are paid if and when declared by
the Company&#146;s board of directors.&#160; In the
event of the liquidation of the Company, holders of common stock would be
entitled to a pro rata distribution of any proceeds remaining after payment to all
of the Company&#146;s creditors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s board of directors has the authority to designate one or
more series of preferred stock, and to fix the designations, powers,
preferences, rights, qualifications, limitations and restrictions of such
series.&#160; If so designated by the board of
directors, the shares of any series of preferred stock could be senior to the
common stock with respect to distributions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock Option Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has approved stock option plans for key employees,
directors, consultants and advisors to the Company.&#160; Options have been granted and are presently
outstanding under the Company&#146;s 1994 Stock Option Plan, 1996 Director Stock
Option Plan and 2000 Stock Incentive Plan.&#160;
The 2000 Stock Incentive Plan has a provision that automatically
increases the authorized shares available for grant on September&nbsp;1 of each
year by the lesser of 300,000 or 1% of the then outstanding common shares.&#160; Under the plans, the compensation committee
of the board of directors grants the options with vesting and the exercise
period being determined at the time of the award.&#160; The purchase price of the stock for
non-qualified and incentive stock options is determined at the time of the award
and is generally equal to the fair market value at the time of the award.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock option transactions for the three years ended March&nbsp;31 were
as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.9%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Options Outstanding</font></b></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.59</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.9%;">

  $13.81</font></p>

  <td width="114" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="94" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, there were 800,251 shares available for
grant under the Company&#146;s 2000 Stock Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2002, the Company repriced stock options to purchase
745,000 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock with exercise prices ranging from
$9.05 to $18.00 to an exercise price of $5.97, which represented the fair
market value on the date of the repricing.&#160;
In accordance with FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;44, &#147;Accounting for
Certain Transactions Involving Stock Compensation,&#148; the Company has adopted
variable plan accounting for these options from the date of the repricing.&#160; In fiscal 2005, the Company had an immaterial
reduction to compensation expense related to the repriced options.&#160; The Company recorded compensation
expense of $2.0 million in fiscal</font> 2004 </font>as a result of the repricing. &#160;No compensation expense was recorded in fiscal
2003 since the options&#146; new exercise price exceeded the fair market value of
the stock as of March&nbsp;31, 2003.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='55',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Earnings
Per Share:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic earnings per common share is computed by dividing net income by
the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the
year.&#160; Diluted earnings per share is
computed by dividing net income by the sum of the weighted average number of
shares of common stock outstanding plus all additional common stock that would
have been outstanding if potentially dilutive common shares related to stock
options and warrants had been exercised.&#160;
Stock options and warrants with an exercise price exceeding the fair
market value of the Company&#146;s common stock at year-end are considered
antidilutive and are excluded from the calculation.&#160; The following table reconciles the number of
shares utilized in the earnings per share calculations for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
in thousands, except per share data:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Segment
Information:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company follows the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;131, &#147;Disclosures
about Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information.&#148;&#160; SFAS No.&nbsp;131 establishes annual and
interim reporting standards for an enterprise&#146;s business segments and related
disclosures about its products, services, geographic areas and major customers.&#160; The method for determining what information
to report is based upon the way management organizes the operating segments
within the Company for making operating decisions and assessing financial
performance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to the acquisition of Big Sky on December&nbsp;1, 2002, the
Company had one reportable segment: Mesaba.&#160;
After the acquisition of Big Sky, the Company has determined that it has
two reportable segments: Mesaba and Big Sky.&#160;
The accounting policies of the segments are the same as those described
in the summary of significant accounting policies in Note 2.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

acquisition) and Holdings were as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.02%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="363" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Commitments
and Contingencies:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Workforce</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately 45.6% of Mesaba&#146;s workforce are members of unions
representing pilots, mechanics, dispatchers and flight attendants.&#160; The collective bargaining agreements for the
pilots, mechanics, dispatchers and flight attendants either became or will
become amendable January&nbsp;2009, August&nbsp;2003, May&nbsp;2005 and April&nbsp;2006,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately 45.0% of Big Sky&#146;s workforce are members of unions
representing pilots, mechanics and dispatchers.&#160;
The collective bargaining agreements for the pilots, mechanics and
dispatchers become amendable December&nbsp;2009, August&nbsp;2010 and December&nbsp;2009,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Railway Labor Act, which governs labor relations for unions
representing airline employees, contains detailed provisions that must be
exhausted before work stoppage&nbsp;can occur once a collective bargaining
agreement becomes amendable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Benefit Plan</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba maintains a 401(k) benefit plan for eligible employees of Holdings
and Mesaba whereby Holdings or Mesaba will match 25% to 125% of employee
contributions to the plan, up to 10% of each employee&#146;s eligible earnings,
depending on the employee&#146;s length of service.&#160;
Holdings&#146; and Mesaba&#146;s expense related to the plan totaled $3.9 million,
$2.0 million and $1.7 million in fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">57</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='57',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky maintains a 401(k) benefit plan covering substantially all of
its employees whereby Big Sky will match 30% of employee contributions to the
plan, up to 5% of each employee&#146;s eligible earnings.&#160; Big Sky&#146;s contribution to the plan was not
significant in fiscal 2005, 2004 or 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock Appreciation Rights Plan</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2004, Mesaba approved a stock appreciation rights (&#147;SAR&#148;)
plan for key employees and directors.&#160; The
exercise price of each SAR is generally equal to the fair market value of the
Company&#146;s common stock on the date of the award. &#160;Cash is paid based on the difference between
the fair market value at the date of grant and the date the SAR is exercised.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2005, 365,000 SARs were issued at a weighted average
exercise price of $7.89 per SAR with four year vesting and expiration in ten
years.&#160; During fiscal 2004, 715,000 SARs
were issued at a weighted average exercise price of $9.81 per SAR with four
year vesting and expiration in ten years.&#160;
No SARs were exercised or cancelled in fiscal 2005 or 2004.&#160; Compensation expense of $0.1 million was
recognized in fiscal 2005 and none in fiscal 2004 since the SAR&#146;s exercise
price exceeded the fair market value of the stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Regulatory Matters</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba and Big Sky are parties to ongoing Federal Aviation
Administration proceedings arising in the ordinary course of business.&#160; In the opinion of management, the resolution
of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is a party to ongoing legal and tax proceedings arising in
the ordinary course of business.&#160; In the
opinion of management, the resolution of these matters will not have a material
adverse effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Aircraft Leasing Lawsuit</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;4, 2002, Fairbrook Leasing,&nbsp;Inc.,
Lambert Leasing,&nbsp;Inc. and Swedish Aircraft Holdings AB (&#147;Saab Leasing&#148;)
filed a declaratory judgment action against Mesaba relating to 20 Saab 340A (&#147;340A&#148;)
aircraft leased by Mesaba.&nbsp; Saab Leasing sought a judicial declaration
that the terms of the leases applicable to each of the 340A aircraft are
governed by a March&nbsp;7, 1996 term sheet proposal rather than the parties&#146;
subsequent agreements and conduct.&nbsp; In a December&nbsp;8, 2003 order, the
District Court declared the term sheet proposal a binding preliminary agreement
requiring Mesaba to negotiate in good faith toward the execution of long-term
agreements for each of the 340A aircraft.&nbsp; Mesaba appealed the District Court&#146;s
ruling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;13, 2004, relying on the
District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling, Saab Leasing filed a separate
action in the District Court alleging approximately $35 million in damages for
past due and future aircraft lease obligations.&nbsp; Mesaba denies the
allegations in Saab Leasing&#146;s complaint and contends that it has fulfilled and
will continue to fulfill its existing obligations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;19, 2005, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit
affirmed the District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling.&nbsp; Despite the
Eighth Circuit&#146;s ruling, Mesaba, based on advice from its legal counsel,
believes that it has defenses in the damages case that will limit Saab Leasing&#146;s
ability to recover damages.&nbsp; Nevertheless, there can be no assurance that
the District Court in the damages case will agree with Mesaba&#146;s analysis.&nbsp;
Therefore, the ultimate outcome of this dispute cannot be predicted with
certainty.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='58',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\05-8337-1\task467693\8337-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 14 10:26 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company did not establish an accrual
with regard to this litigation.&#160;
Accordingly, an adverse outcome to this matter could have a material
impact on the Company&#146;s financial condition and results of operation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Nonoperating
Gain:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April&nbsp;2003, Congress enacted the Emergency Wartime Supplemental
Appropriations Act.&#160; Among other items,
the legislation included a $2.3 billion government grant to U.S. airlines.&#160; In accordance with this Act, for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2004, Mesaba recognized $2.3 million as &#147;other nonoperating
income&#148; and Big Sky recognized $0.3 million as &#147;other nonoperating income&#148; and
$0.2 million as a reduction of &#147;administrative and other expense&#148; in the
accompanying consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2001, Congress enacted the Air Transportation Safety
and System Stabilization Act.&#160; The legislation
provided cash grants to U.S. airlines to compensate for &#147;direct and incremental
losses&#148; incurred from September&nbsp;11, 2001 through December&nbsp;31, 2001.&#160; Mesaba recognized a pre-tax grant of approximately
$12.5&nbsp;million as &#147;other nonoperating income&#148; in the accompanying
consolidated statements of operations in fiscal 2003, in accordance with Department
of Transportation and applicable authoritative accounting guidance.&#160; Mesaba received approximately
$2.2&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003.&#160; In
addition, Big Sky recognized and received $0.2&nbsp;million during the period
from December&nbsp;1, 2002 (date of acquisition) to March&nbsp;31, 2003 under
the same program.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Restatement:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent
to the issuance of its consolidated financial statements for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2004, the Company determined that it had incorrectly accounted for certain
aircraft leases that contained reduced rent obligations over a portion of the
lease term.&#160; This resulted in an
understatement of other assets, net, other noncurrent liabilities and aircraft
rents and an overstatement of retained earnings, shareholders&#146; equity and net
income in prior periods.&#160; Although the
Company does not believe that this error resulted in a material misstatement of
the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for any prior annual periods as
presented below, the effects of correcting the error as of December&nbsp;31,
2004 would have had a material effect on the Company&#146;s results of operations
for that period.&#160; As a result, the
accompanying consolidated financial statements for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2004 and 2003 have been restated from the amounts previously reported.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of the significant effects of the restatement is as follows, in
thousands, except per share information:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="48%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:48.5%;">

  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.1%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Reported</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.1%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Restated</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.52%;">

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="363" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="76" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="76" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
restatement also resulted in a decrease in retained earnings and shareholders&#146;
equity as of April&nbsp;1, 2002 of $0.3 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Valuation
and Qualifying Account:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is the activity within Company&#146;s valuation and qualifying
account for fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">16.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font>Quarterly
Financial Data (Unaudited):</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

2005, in thousands, except per share data:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*
</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The sum of the earnings (loss) per share for each of the individual
quarters does not equal earnings per share for the fiscal year due to rounding.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">20,333</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">

  <td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.0%;">

  </td>

  </td>

  </td>
